context: The Estonian verb 'näha' means 'to see'. It is the da-infinitive form of the word 'nägema'. This verb expresses the act of perceiving something with one's eyes. In different grammatical contexts, it may be conjugated to show who is doing the seeing and what they are seeing. For example, 'ma näen' means 'I see', 'sa näed' means 'you see', and so on.
